entry.title: 职场英语
entry.content:
职场英语复习题

复习内容

  1. 1-7单元文章（除去2）。

  2. 课后判断题

  3. 课后匹配题

  4. 作文，跟课文相关。

U1

A

课后判断题

  1. Dress conservatively and professionally. T

穿着保守而专业

  1. Turn up 15 minutes earlier for the interview. F

提前15分钟来面试

  1. Shake hands with the interviewers while looking them in the eye. T

看着面试官的眼睛，与他们握手。

  1. Treat the interviewers with all you respect, neglect others, like receptionist etc. F

尊重面试官忽略其他人，如接待员等。

  1. Keep your back straight and sit bolt upright in your chair. F

保持背部挺直，笔直地坐在椅子上。

  1. Talk to the interviewers as if they were your friends. F

与面试官交谈，就好像他们是你的朋友一样。

  1. Don’t be the icebreaker. T

不要成为破冰者。

TEXT A

面试礼仪，职业装，时间上提前到， 肢体语言，言谈，事后礼仪

B

课后判断题

  1. The complete lack of preparation is the number one problem with job candidates. T

完全缺乏准备是求职者的首要问题。

  1. If you apply for a job of accountant in the hospital, you don’t need to know anything about the health care industry. F

如果你在医院申请会计工作，你不需要了解任何有关医疗行业的知识。

  1. You should learn more about the jobs you’re interested in. T

你应该多了解你感兴趣的工作。

  1. If candidates have substantial education, training, and work experience, they can do a good job of presenting their skills for that job in the interview. F

如果应聘者具有自己丰富的教育，培训，和工作经验，他们可以在面试中很好地展示自己的技能。

  1. If you read the job description before the interview and mention the key skills that job requires in an interview, your chances of being employed will be increased. T

如果你在面试前阅读了工作描述，并在面试中提到了工作所需的关键技能，你被录用的机会就会增加。

  1. Knowing the specific skills a job requires can help you make a better resume because you can focus on those skills in your resume. T

了解一份工作需要的具体技能可以帮助你制作一份更好的简历，因为你可以在简历中专注于这些技能。

  1. The school career center can provide some information of the company usually. T

学校就业中心通常可以提供公司的一些信息。

  1. To conduct company research, you can’t ignore the Web. T

要进行公司调查，你不能忽视网络。

  1. You should know the company through the company’s advertisement. T

你可以通过公司的广告了解公司。

  1. It is unnecessary to get in touch with the alumni who work for the company. F

没有必要与为公司工作的校友联系。

TEXT B

调查公司-面试前的重要一步。

便于回答问题，需要知道什么，找到细节，

U2

课后匹配题

Financial Account 财务

​ Keeps the financial records of the company保存公司的财务记录

Personnel 人事部门

​ Looks after the welfare of the employees照顾员工福利

​ Trains new staff培训新员工

Hires new employees雇佣新员工

Purchasing 采购部门

​ Orders the materials needed by the company订购公司所需材料

Production生产部门

​ Works with the manufacturing side of the company与公司的制造部门合作

Research and Development研究和开发部门

​ Is responsible for developing负责开发新产品

Sales and Marketing销售和营销部门

​ Males sure the customers know about new products确保客户了解新产品

​ Carries out market research进行市场调查

Looks for new customers寻找新客户

​ Is responsible for selling the goods负责销售货物

Transportation运输部门

​ Is responsible for delivering goods to the customers负责向客户交付货物

课后判断题

  1. A board of directors has a different name, such as board of trustees, board of governors, board of managers, or executive board. T

董事会具有不同名称,如董事会，经理委员会，或执行委员会。

  1. Typically the board chooses one of its members to be the chair or chairperson of the board of directors, traditionally also called CEO. F

通常，董事会会选择其一名成员担任董事会主席或董事会主任，传统上也称为首席执行官。

  1. The chairman is the highest officer of an organized group such as a board, committee, or deliberative assembly. T

主席是有组织团体的最高官员。

  1. The chairman is the head of the management committee and usually reports to the board, which is headed by the CEO. F

董事会是管理委员会的负责人，通常向由首席执行官领导的董事会报告。

  1. In the case of companies and similarly-organized bodies, there are generally two types of Chair: Non-executive and Executive. T

就公司和类似组织机构而言，通常有俩种类型的主席；非执行主席，和执行主席。

  1. A CEO usually has several subordinate executives such as a chief financial officer(CFO), chief operating officer (COO), chief technical officer (CTO), chief marketing officer (CMO),chief information officer(CIO), chief creative officer(CCO). T

首席执行官通常有几个下属执行官，如首席财务官，首席运营官，首席技术官，首席营销官，首席信息官，首席创意官。

  1. The board of directors manages day to day contact—writes press releases etc. F

董事会负责管理日常联系人，撰写新闻稿等。

U3

Sb’s speaking

It’s sb’s calling

I’m afraid sth

Do you have a pen handy

Hold on a moment please

Would you mind doing sth

B as in Bravo

Thanks for calling.

课后判断题

  1. It doesn’t matter that you leave the phone ringing for a long time without picking it up. F

  2. It is wrong to identify yourself when you are answering the phone. F

  3. You’ll need to understand how to transfer calls internally and you should also keep a pen and pad handy so you can jot down details of the call. T

  4. The information you could be looking to gather might include the caller’s name, company name (if applicable), time and date of call, reason for call and their contact details. T

  5. It is a good practice to let the caller hang up before you do. T

  6. It doesn’t matter that you answer the phone while eating. F

  7. You could always answer the personal call at work and talk for a long time. F

  8. You should identify yourself and your company first when you make a business phone call. T

  9. When you are connected with the person, state the purpose of your calland then be sure to ask if you are calling at a convenient time. T

  10. When you lesve a message or voicemail for someone, make it as long as possible, leave the details there to make sure others are clear about your message. F

  11. Speakerphones are useful for conference calls. If you are leading a speakerphone meeting with a number of people, allow each person to introduce himself or herself, to help the listeners match a name to a voice. T

  12. People can’t move around in the room when using a special hands-free headset-type telephone. F

U4

  1. Every meeting needs an agenda.

  2. The sectary keeps the minutes.

  3. A meeting needs a chairperson to lead the discussion.

  4. Before the main meeting we had a short brainstormng meeting.

  5. At 12:30 we decide to adjourn for lunch.

  6. Mr black will address the meeting on my behalf.

  7. Let me know what the objective of the meeting os.

  8. I have a proposal to make.

  9. No one voted against the decision was unanimous.

  10. Thank you very much. I think that covers every point. Is there anything else?

  11. As a chairperson, before holding a meeting, you should also decide who should attend and what the purpose of the meeting is. T

  12. It is better to distribute the meeting agenda three days prior to the meeting day. T

  13. It is OK that you begin a meeting five to seven minutes after it was scheduled. F

  14. It is not necessary to the agenda during the meeting. F

  15. We should respect different viewpoints during the meeting. T

  16. A well-planned agenda, posted ground rules, and using a bin can help meeting run effectively. T

  17. The relaxing atmosphere is not good for the meeting to be productive. F

U5

How many flights are there from NewYork to Beijing.每星期从纽约到北京有那些航班？

I’d like to book a ticket to NewYork next Monday.我想预定一张下星期一去纽约的机票

I prefer a morning flight.最好是早上的航班

What’s the fare of an economy class.经济舱的票价是多少

Is it a direct flight.是直达航班吗

When does it arrive at NewYork什么时候到纽约

  1. Collect information in file folder. Make it the repository for contact names, airline tickets, hotel and so on. T

  2. Dress appropriately for maximum comfort, if you are not traveling with a client. T

  3. Eat whatever you like on the plane. F

  4. Try to give yourself a few hours rest when you get to your hotel or accommodation, if you are not hurry for the meeting. T

  5. For the informal activities, man could dress casually such as sport jackets, slacks, and light weight sweaters. T

  6. For women, conservatism is again the key requirement, No backless, sleeveless, or strapless dresses for business. T

  7. It doesn’t matter if you get late for the meeting for 2 or 3 minutes. F

  8. Business lunch or dinner usually means you should wear a suit or other professional attire. T

  9. Greet your host. Hugging is the usual way, particularly if it is a business function. F

  10. It is impolite to sit down before your host say to sit, no matter they are seated or not. F

  11. Put your napkin on your chest, F

  12. White wine is recommended for res meat and heavy dishes; res for fish, chicken. And vegetables. F

  13. For the formal sinner setting, knives are on the left and forks are on the right. F

  14. If someone asks for the salt, pass salt only. F

  15. When butter is being passed, cut a pat and place it on your bread plate. T

  16. Don’t put your elbows on the table. T

  17. Use the restroom to pick food out of your teeth or repair your makeup. T

U6

  1. George, how about having dinner with us tonight?

On, how nice of you! I’ll be very glad to come.

  1. I’ll meet you at the entrance of the hotel at six tomorrow evening. Is that OK?

Very well. I’ll be waiting for you then.

  1. May I propose a toast to brisk business and continuing development?

Thanks. Here’s to your health and success in business as well.

  1. May I have the bill, please?

Certainly, here you are.

  1. Waitress, can I pay with a traveler’s check?

I’m afraid not. We can only accept cash.

  1. Miss, what’s this amount for?

It’s the service charge.

  1. Sir, may I take a print of your card?

Just a moment. I’ll get a print of your card?

  1. Please put it on my bill.

Certainly sir. Thank you.

  1. You’d better make sure guest is aware of the purpose of the gathering at the initial invitation. T

  2. A vegetarian dish in the menu is necessary. T

  3. It is the duty of the guest to “call the meal to order.” F

  4. All good guests at a business or social meal will wait for the host to begin before starting their own meals. As a host, don’t keep them waiting. T

  5. You’d better call other’s attention to the fact that you are paying the bill. F

U7

  1. Could you give me an introduction about your products? 能给我介绍一下你们的产品吗？

  2. You can see the price of each type of product on the price list.您能在价目表上看到每种产品的价格。

  3. When will you deliver the product? 什么时候能发货？

  4. I want to know how much discount you can give? 我想知道你们能做多少折扣？

  5. Would you need a catalogue? 您需要一份产品目录吗？

  6. Exhibitors usually sell more products at trade shows than sales calls. F

  7. It takes a comparatively short amount of time to reach the customers at trade show. T

  8. Everyone who visits your display knows the detail of your product or service. F

  9. The most valuable thing a trade show provides is opportunity for future communications. T

  10. Before sending your booth staffers, you need to consider the weather of the place where the trade show is held. F

  11. Asking non-competing exhibitors about the previous show is a good way to find the best shows to attend. T

  12. Offering food to attendees is an excellent idea. F

Factors needed to be considered

​ The amount of money it costs to attend the show.参加演出的费用

​ Where there are decision makers for your industry or not.你所在行业是否有决策者

​ Past attendees’ opinions.过去与会者的意见

​ How the show promotion goes.演出的促销活动开始了

​ What the conference schedules are.会议日程安排是什么

entry.title: 初次搭建博客的心得
entry.content:
初步建立自己博客的一些感受

​ 机缘巧合之下，知道了一位研友正在搭建自己的博客。正巧自己也刷到了用hexo来搭建博客的视频。视频简短，以为搭建博客会很简单，但自己实际搭建后才发现，自己每一步都会出现各种各样的问题。

​ 磕磕绊绊下，初步搭建了自己的博客，可以正常的发布文章。但是一些美化，自定义的一些东西，始终不得章法。开始思考，我用博客是为了干什么。很多开源的主题一直在坚持不断地跟新，可相关的一些搭建美化教程却越来越少了。对我这个初建博客的小白来说，非常的不友好。往往找到的一些美化方法，却因为或多或少的各种更新迭代，导致现在不再适用。而自己又实在是难以下手去解决这些因为更新带来的难题。即便是Matery这个主题，一直在更新。但是作者的教程说明却已经是三年前的了，仔细对比现在的代码，已经有着不小的变化。且在自定义的方面，也并没有详细说明。

​ 搭建博客，对于现在的我来说，有着不小的难度。因为我也想让自己的博客能体现自己的个性。希望自己能不断学习，能够完成这一心愿。
